issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

In an own app as well as in Kitchen Sink (try map view with route under base ui => views) free memory drops (in tests 2 to 14(!) MB) each and every time you zoom (no matter which way). The memory is never freed (however it doesn't seem to sink below 6MB free memory). This is a very serious issue as apps crash or seem to freeze when user zooms a lot and some other memory intense process is running as well.

Tried the following SDKs: 1.4.2 and 1.5.1

{html}

comments.body: I recently reimplemented the map zooming code and think that this problem has probably been fixed.  Please regress.
using 1.8.0 and an ipad2 (4.3.5) and an ipod touch (4.0.2) The massively leaking has been addressed. New bug for the small leaks seen coming.
